law.catch_line: Confidentiality of information obtained in practice.

text.section: A licensee shall not, without the consent of his client, disclose any confidential information pertaining to his client obtained in the course of performing professional services.

Members of the board and professional practice reviewers shall not disclose any confidential client information which comes to their attention from licensees in disciplinary proceedings or otherwise in carrying out their responsibilities, except that they may furnish such information to an investigative or disciplinary body of the kind referred to above.

law.history: Amended 1984 Ky. Acts ch. 117, sec. 19, effective July 13, 1984. -- Created 1946 Ky. Acts ch. 210, sec. 20.
